page.title: 08QUARRIES IN RATHO
page.content: THERE ARE TWO WORKING QUARRIES IN THE RATHO AREA. HILLWOOD QUARRY IS OWNED AND RUN BY WIMPEY AND CRAIGPARK QUARRY IS OWNED AND RUN BY KINGS. BOTH THESE QUARRIES PRODUCE THE SAME TYPE OF STONE. THE QUARRIES WERE STARTED IN THE EARLY 1900'S AND HAVE BEEN GREATLY ENLARGED SINCE THEN. THE QUARRIES ARE ABOUT 50 METRES DEEP AND COVER AN AREA OF ABOUT THIRTY ACRES EACH. IN ONE YEAR THEY MINE ABOUT FOUR HUNDRED THOUSAND TONS OF STONE. THE STONE QUARRIED IS A BASALT WHICH IS VERY HARD AND IS USED MAINLY FOR MAKING ROADS AND FOR MIXING WITH CEMENT TO MAKE CONCRETE. THERE IS BLASTING AT THE QUARRIES ABOUT ONCE A WEEK. EACH BLAST TAKES ABOUT 2.5 TONS OF EXPLOSIVE. WHEN THE BLASTING TAKES PLACE, THE EFFECT CAN BE FELT IN THE VILLAGE OF RATHO AS THE HOUSES SHAKE FROM THE EXPLOSION.
